intro: Razoumofskya gracilis, commonly known as the slender razoumofskya, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
